search_parameters.q: does your employer have to pay for covid leave

related_questions.question: Which states still require COVID pay?
related_questions.snippet: Similar mandates under California state law and in New York City expired at the end of 2022, and in October 2022 in Washington state and Washington, DC. Some jurisdictions still have COVID-19 leave requirements in place, including New York state, Los Angeles County and Oakland, CA.
related_questions.title: States, cities tackle COVID-19 paid leave - Mercer

related_questions.question: What is the sick pay law in Illinois?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Eligibility: Most employees in Illinois, including domestic workers, are covered by the PLAWA, with the exception of independent contractors and those working for school districts or park districts.
Accrual: Employees earn paid leave at a rate of one hour for every 40 hours worked.
Usage: Employees can use the accrued paid leave for any reason.
Employer cannot: Require employees to provide a reason for taking leave.  Request documentation or certification to support the leave request.
Require employees to provide a reason for taking leave.
Request documentation or certification to support the leave request.
Carryover: Employers can set a carryover cap for unused paid leave, according to Littler Mendelson P.C..

Relationship to Existing Policies: If an employer already has a paid time off policy that provides at least 40 hours of paid leave for any reason, they may not need to change their existing policy, says Cook County (.gov).
Employee Sick Leave Act (ESLA): This act requires employers with existing sick leave policies to allow employees to use a portion of that leave for the care of family members, according to SixFifty.

related_questions.question: What is the California paid sick leave policy?
related_questions.snippet: California paid sick leave laws mandate protected time off for health and safety needs under the Healthy Workplaces, Healthy Families Act. Most employers must provide up to 40 hours or 5 days of sick leave annually, ensuring workers can take care of their health without compromising their job security.
related_questions.title: California Paid Sick Leave Laws and Requirements for 2025 - SixFifty

related_questions.question: What is the paid leave policy in Illinois?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Accrual: Employees earn paid leave at a rate of one hour for every 40 hours worked.
Usage: Employees can use the paid leave for any reason, and employers cannot require them to provide a reason or documentation.
Frontloading: Employers can choose to provide the full 40 hours of paid leave at the beginning of the year or at the start of employment.
Minimum Increment: Employers may set a reasonable minimum increment for using paid leave, not to exceed 2 hours per day, according to the Illinois Department of Labor.
Carryover: Accrued but unused leave must be carried over to the next 12-month period, but employers can limit the carryover to 40 hours.
Notice: Employers can have a reasonable policy for advance notice of foreseeable leave requests, such as 7 days, and notice as soon as practically possible for unforeseeable leave.
Exceptions: Certain categories of workers and employers with existing, comparable paid leave policies may be exempt.
Retaliation: Employers cannot take adverse action against employees who take paid leave under the act, according to the Illinois Department of Labor.
